headline: E. Coli Outbreak Linked to McDonald’s Quarter Pounders No Longer a Safety Concern, Feds Say
summary: Federal health officials said the E. coli outbreak linked to slivered onions on McDonald’s Quarter Pounders is no longer a safety concern.  At least 104 people have been infected, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said in an update Wednesday, up from the 90 cases the agency reported on Oct. 30.  One person, an older adult in Colorado, died, the FDA said last month.

headline: Should You Buy, Sell or Retain McDonald's Stock at a 23.91X P/E?
summary: MCD faces challenges, including declining comparable store sales and an E. coli outbreak. However, expansion efforts and menu innovation bode well.

headline: McDonald’s USA, Syngenta and Lopez Foods Collaborate to Help Produce Beef More Sustainably in the US
summary: BASEL, Switzerland & CHICAGO, November 14, 2024--McDonald’s USA, one of the largest fast food restaurant chains, Lopez Foods, a multi-protein producer and long-term supplier to McDonald’s, and Syngenta North America, a leader in agricultural technology, today announced a collaboration that aims to increase feed efficiency and help reduce the amount of greenhouse gas emissions released per pound of meat produced, as part of efforts to improve the sustainability of beef production.

raw.headline: McDonald’s USA, Syngenta and Lopez Foods Collaborate to Help Produce Beef More Sustainably in the US

headline: McDonald’s and Syngenta team up to create a more sustainable hamburger
summary: The fast-food giant and meat supplier Lopez Foods will pay farmers to use Syngenta's Enogen corn to drive feed efficiencies and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
